front.title: Use of the RSA-KEM Key Transport Algorithm in CMS

abstract.t: The RSA-KEM Key Transport Algorithm is a one-pass (store-and-forward) mechanism for transporting keying data to a recipient using the recipient's RSA public key. This document specifies the conventions for using the RSA-KEM Key Transport Algorithm with the Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS). This version (-02) updates the ASN.1 syntax to align with the latest draft of ANS X9.44 and ISO/IEC 18033-2, and adds material on Camillia algorirthm.
